impact_weight: The reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can be achieved through the use of renewable energy sources, which in turn can aid in the achievement of renewable energy targets.
Improving energy efficiency can contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, thereby supporting the achievement of energy efficiency targets.
The development of net-zero technology for road vehicles can create conditions that further the production of renewable hydrogen, which can be used as a clean energy source.

The promotion of net-zero technology for road vehicles can enable the development of more energy-efficient buildings, as the focus on sustainability can lead to the adoption of energy-efficient practices in the building sector.
The use of biofuels can create conditions that further the development of renewable energy sources, as biofuels can be produced from renewable biomass.
The development of other low-carbon fuels can enable the growth of solar energy, as the focus on low-carbon fuels can lead to increased investment in solar energy technologies.
The development of hydrogen distribution infrastructure is inextricably linked to the production of renewable hydrogen, as the two are interdependent.

The promotion of urban mobility can enable the development of more energy-efficient buildings, as the focus on sustainable transportation can lead to the adoption of energy-efficient practices in the building sector.

The development of sustainable transport logistics can create conditions that further the development of renewable energy sources, as the focus on sustainability can lead to increased investment in renewable energy technologies.
